page.title: 09 Bushmills Centre
page.content:
Bushmills Centre is a residential centre for young people run by the North Eastern Education and Library Board. It is used by youth groups and school groups for activities such as conferences, geographical and biological fieldwork and outdoor pursuit activities such as canoeing, climbing and sailing. The centre occupies the building which was formerly the old Bushmills Grammar School which became comprehensive and moved to a new site in 1974. The centre was opened in 1979.
In the outdoor centre there are a total of fourteen workers. They consist of cooks, cleaners, stores, office and instructional staff. At the most, during the week, they have thirty visiting young people and staff and at the week-end they have twenty-five.
